dataset.name: Supported Self Care (Supported Self Management)
dataset.description: The supported self care section supports wound care self management, it allows for the recording of educational elements, including structured and unstructured training and the provision to record documents and images that the person (or their carer) have provided

concept.name: Documents (including correspondence, audio and images)
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section includes details for documents and images. It includes the metadata that is required for the document or image and a link to the actual document or image. When displayed in a record, documents and images should be organised logically in date order. Local implementations will need to determine the best logical groupings for use here.  

The system SHOULD be able to receive and display images of wound and limbs taken at home on their personal device.
concept.description: Details about documents related to the person.

concept.name: Documents
concept.description: This is the documents record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Documentation location
concept.description: The location of the document

concept.name: Confidentiality
concept.description: The code specifying the level of confidentiality of the document.

concept.name: Class
concept.description: The document type e.g. report, summary, images, treatment plan, patient preferences, workflow

concept.name: Document title
concept.description: The title of the document.

concept.name: Document name
concept.description:
The name of the document. This should align to the PRSB document naming standard. Where the document is a KOS document this field (designated typeCode) is used to carry the DICOM Imaging procedure: This attribute shall be populated by the XDS-I Imaging Document Source from a code in the Procedure Code Sequence (0008,1032) of the performed procedure
                            with which the document is associated. Values may be found in a suitable DICOM browser
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - As per the https://theprsb.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Clinical-document-indexing-standards_NHS-Scotland.pdf

concept.name: Document MIME type
concept.description: MIME type of the document e.g. application, pdf, audio, jpeg

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The high level imaging speciality code e.g. (R-3027B, SRT, “Radiology”)

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for service
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT :- ^1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Comments
concept.description: Comments associated with the document.

concept.name: Additional information required for images.
concept.description: Additional information required for images.

concept.name: Image procedure
concept.description: The procedure used to capture the image
concept.valueSets:
Free text
Using DICOM code set https://dicom.innolitics.com/ciods

concept.name: Image procedure date
concept.description: The date and time the image procedure was performed.

concept.name: Images
concept.description: Images details.

concept.name: Image capture date
concept.description: The date and time when the image was captured.

concept.name: Image ID
concept.description: A unique image identifier generated by the system.

concept.name: Image location
concept.description: The URL for the image

concept.name: Format code
concept.description: The format code of the document which provides information on how to display the document.

concept.name: Event code list
concept.description: The type of image (acquisition modality) and the anatomical site imaged.

concept.name: Comments
concept.description: Comments associated with the imaging

concept.name: Structured education
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The attendance code includes the type of education that was attended, therefore you don’t need to list the education separately 

The referral for structured education would be recorded in the referrals sectionThe system SHOULD be able to receive and display information about a person's attendance at structured education courses where other systems are conformant with the standard.

Details of attendance and outcome to be recorded in this section and details of referrals to structured education to be recorded under referral details

The attendance code includes the type of education that was attended, therefore you don’t need to list the education separately

The referral for structured education would be recorded in the referrals section
concept.description: Details of the person's participation in structured education programmes.

concept.name: Structured education record entry
concept.description: This is a structured education record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Attendance
concept.description: Details of the person's attendance on a structured education programme.

concept.name: Attendance
concept.description: Details of the person's attendance at structured education programme (could be partial or full).

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for attendance.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used when code is not available.

concept.name: Structured education outcome
concept.description: Details of the structured education outcome.

concept.name: Structured education outcome
concept.description: The outcome of the structured education programme.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for structured education outcome.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used when code is not available.

concept.name: Unstructured Education
concept.description: Not formal education

concept.name: Information and advice given
concept.description: A description of pertinent aspects, including the information and advice given to the person as part of the team talk. This should include any decision support tools used and where a copy of these can be securely obtained.
